title: The Scale Revolution in Physics: Historical and Philosophical Perspectives
descriptions:
The Scale Revolution in Physics: Historical and Philosophical Perspectives (RESCALE) is a multifaceted project that aims to elucidate the historical and philosophical underpinnings of the shift towards scale-based theoretical practice in modern physics. This transformation, which has occurred since the 1950s, has resulted in theories that operate effectively within certain scales, contributing to a complex and layered world picture.

The RESCALE project is driven by four key objectives: (1) to comprehend the impact of the ideal of a final theory on modern physics and its philosophical interpretations; (2) to scrutinize the paradigm shift in physics towards scale-specific theories; (3) to evaluate the necessity for philosophers to recalibrate their interpretative practices in the context of scale-based physics; and (4) to explore the worldview that emerges from a scale-based perspective.

The significance of this study is twofold: (1) it unveils a profound epistemological transformation in the recent history of science; and (2) it addresses the implications of this transformation for our understanding of representation, reduction, realism, and metaphysics at the frontiers of science.

The methodology of the RESCALE project is two-pronged: (1) a historical study of the evolution of scale-based theoretical practice in physics; and (2) a philosophical analysis of the implications of scale-based physics.

By shedding light on the historical and philosophical aspects of scale-based physics, the RESCALE project promises to enrich our understanding of modern physics and its interpretations. This project will not only reveal a fundamental transformation in the history of science but also address its implications for our understanding of key philosophical concepts at the forefront of scientific inquiry.
